description: This table shows the details of a soft tissue finding.

columns.name: FINDING_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier for the finding record

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE_REAL
columns.description: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE
columns.description: The date of this contact in calendar format.

columns.name: ST_FIND_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The soft tissue finding type, documenting severity of the finding.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Malignant Lesion


Pre-Malignant Lesion


Benign Lesion


Neoplasm


Other

columns.name: ST_AVAT_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The soft tissue avatar type, which is either extraoral or intraoral.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Extraoral


Intraoral

columns.name: ST_FIND_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The current status of the soft tissue finding, which is either unresolved, resolved, or removed.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Resolved


Unresolved


Removed

columns.name: ST_MOD_USER_ID
columns.description: A unique user identifier that consists of the name and the user ID of the user that modified the soft tissue finding.

columns.name: ST_MOD_INST_DTTM
columns.description: The instant when the soft tissue finding was modified.

columns.name: DX_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the diagnosis associated with the soft tissue finding.

columns.name: REGION_RECORD_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the anatomy region associated with the soft tissue finding.

columns.name: FINDING_LOC
columns.description: The exact coordinates of the soft tissue finding based on the coordinate system of the avatar it was documented on. If the finding is an icon (point and click tool), this item stores the coordinates of the center of the finding icon. If the finding is selected using the region selection tool, this item is left blank since the region ID is already stored in item 17004.

columns.name: FINDING_COUNT
columns.description: The number of findings this soft tissue finding represents. Allows user to document like findings in the same region under one soft tissue finding record.

columns.name: FINDING_LOC_NAME
columns.description: The display name of the soft tissue finding that overrides the finding's default name of the associated anatomy region.
